intro: Brachystelma richardsii, commonly known as the Richardsii stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Crassulaceae and is characterized by its fleshy, thick leaves that store water, allowing it to survive in arid conditions. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink or white, typically blooming in summer. It is often found growing on rocky outcrops or in sandy soils, where it thrives in full sun. Due to its unique appearance and hardy nature, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
